pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:0.5.eng: 30. The training rule on what was intended

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyaṃ aññatarassa pūgassa saṅghassa sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyattaṃ hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.2.eng: an association had prepared a meal together with robe-cloth for the Sangha,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.3.eng: intending to offer the robe-cloth after giving the meal.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.4.pli: Atha kho chabbaggiyā bhikkhū yena so pūgo tenupasaṅkamiṃsu;
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.4.eng: But the monks from the group of six went to that association

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.8.eng: We’ve prepared our annual alms-offering together with robe-cloth for the Sangha.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.9.pli: “Bahū, āvuso, saṅghassa dāyakā, bahū saṅghassa bhattā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.9.eng: “The Sangha has many donors and supporters.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.10.pli: Mayaṃ tumhe nissāya tumhe sampassantā idha viharāma.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.10.eng: But since we’re staying here, we look to you for support.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.11.pli: Tumhe ce amhākaṃ na dassatha, atha ko carahi amhākaṃ dassati?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.11.eng: If you don’t give to us, who will?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.13.pli: Atha kho so pūgo chabbaggiyehi bhikkhūhi nippīḷiyamāno yathāpaṭiyattaṃ cīvaraṃ chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ datvā saṅghaṃ bhattena parivisi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.13.eng: Being pressured by the monks from the group of six, that association gave the prepared robe-cloth to them and served the food to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū jānanti saṅghassa sacīvarabhattaṃ paṭiyattaṃ, na ca jānanti chabbaggiyānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ dinnanti, te evamāhaṃsu—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.14.eng: The monks who knew that a meal together with robe-cloth had been prepared for the Sangha, but who did not know that the robe-cloth had been given to the monks from the group of six, said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.17.pli: Yathāpaṭiyattaṃ cīvaraṃ ayyā chabbaggiyā attano pariṇāmesun”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.17.eng: The monks from the group of six have diverted to themselves the robe-cloth we had prepared.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.18.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.18.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.19.pli: “kathañhi nāma chabbaggiyā bhikkhū jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmessantī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.19.eng: “How could the monks from the group of six divert to themselves things they knew were intended for the Sangha?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.20.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū chabbaggiye bhikkhū anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.20.eng: After rebuking those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.21.pli: “saccaṃ kira tumhe, bhikkhave, jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmethā”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.21.eng: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.24.pli: kathañhi nāma tumhe, moghapurisā, jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmessatha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.24.eng: “Foolish men, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.26.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.26.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.27.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:1.27.1.eng: ‘If a monk diverts to himself material support that he knows was intended for the Sangha, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.6.pli: sāmaṃ vā jānāti aññe vā tassa ārocenti so vā āroceti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.6.eng: he knows by himself or others have told him or the donor has told him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.6.comm: The meaning of the last of these three ways of knowing, so vā āroceti, is not clear. CPD suggests: “sa (sā) āroceti (?). Perhaps this last form is conformable to sa. ārocayate med. caus. in the meaning: he or she makes inquiries (of others).” However, this does not fit with the parallel usage at Bu Pc 29:3.1.6 where the text says that she tells (sā vā āroceti) him, presumably referring to the nun telling the monk. In this case āroceti cannot refer to the monk making inquiries. The commentaries are silent, and I therefore assume that a straightforward meaning is the most likely one. I would suggest, then, that it simply refers to the donor telling the monk directly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.8.eng: given to the Sangha, given up to the Sangha.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.10.eng: robe-cloth, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicinal supplies; even a bit of bath powder, a tooth cleaner, or a piece of string.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.13.eng: If he diverts it to himself, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.14.eng: When he gets it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.15.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.15.eng: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.16.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.17.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.18.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.18.eng: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I diverted to myself knowing that it was intended for the Sangha, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.19.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.23.1.pli: Pariṇate pariṇatasaññī attano pariṇāmeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.23.1.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha and he perceives it as such, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.24.pli: Pariṇate vematiko attano pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.24.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, and he diverts it to himself, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.25.eng: If it was intended for the Sangha, but he does not perceive it as such, and he diverts it to himself, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.26.pli: Saṅghassa pariṇataṃ aññasaṅghassa vā cetiyassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.26.eng: If it was intended for one Sangha and he diverts it to another Sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.27.pli: Cetiyassa pariṇataṃ aññacetiyassa vā saṅghassa vā puggalassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.27.eng: If it was intended for one shrine and he diverts it to another shrine or to a sangha or to an individual, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.28.pli: Puggalassa pariṇataṃ aññapuggalassa vā saṅghassa vā cetiyassa vā pariṇāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.28.eng: If it was intended for an individual and he diverts it to another individual or to a sangha or to a shrine, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.29.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.30.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.31.eng: If it was not intended for the Sangha and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.33.pli: kattha demāti pucchiyamāno yattha tumhākaṃ deyyadhammo paribhogaṃ vā labheyya paṭisaṅkhāraṃ vā labheyya ciraṭṭhitiko vā assa yattha vā pana tumhākaṃ cittaṃ pasīdati tattha dethāti bhaṇati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.33.eng: if being asked, “Where may we give?” he says, “Give where your gift will be useful;” “Give where it goes toward repairs;” “Give where it will last for a long time;” “Give where you feel inspired;”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.35.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.36.eng: The training rule on what was intended, the tenth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.37.eng: The third subchapter on almsbowls is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.40.eng: Rainy season, the fifth on a gift;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.43.pli: “Uddiṭṭhā kho, āyasmanto, tiṃsa nissaggiyā pācittiyā dhammā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.43.eng: “Venerables, the thirty rules on relinquishment and confession have been recited.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.44.eng: In regard to this I ask you,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.50.eng: You are pure in this and therefore silent.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.52.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing relinquishment is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np30:2.53.eng: The canonical text beginning with offenses entailing expulsion is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:0.5.eng: 4. The training rule on used robes

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato udāyissa purāṇadutiyikā bhikkhunīsu pabbajitā hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.2.eng: Venerable Udāyī’s ex-wife became a nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.3.pli: Sā āyasmato udāyissa santike abhikkhaṇaṃ āgacchati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.4.pli: Āyasmāpi udāyī tassā bhikkhuniyā santike abhikkhaṇaṃ gacchati.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī tassā bhikkhuniyā santike bhattavissaggaṃ karoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.5.eng: And Udāyī shared his meals with that nun.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.6.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī pubbaṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya yena sā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā tassā bhikkhuniyā purato aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.6.eng: One morning Udāyī robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to her. He then uncovered his genitals in front of her and sat down on a seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.7.pli: Sāpi kho bhikkhunī āyasmato udāyissa purato aṅgajātaṃ vivaritvā āsane nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.7.eng: She too uncovered her genitals in front of him and sat down on a seat.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.8.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī sāratto tassā bhikkhuniyā aṅgajātaṃ upanijjhāyi. Tassa asuci mucci.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.8.eng: Lustfully staring at her genitals, he emitted semen.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā udāyī taṃ bhikkhuniṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.9.eng: He then said to that nun:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.10.eng: “Sister, get some water. I’ll wash the robe.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.11.eng: “Give it to me, venerable, I’ll wash it.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.12.pli: taṃ asuciṃ ekadesaṃ mukhena aggahesi ekadesaṃ aṅgajāte pakkhipi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.12.eng: She then took some of the semen in her mouth and inserted some into her vagina.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.13.eng: Because of that she became pregnant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.15.eng: “This nun doesn’t abstain from sex. She’s pregnant.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.16.eng: She said, “Venerables, I do abstain from sex,” and she told them what had happened.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.17.eng: The nuns complained and criticized Udāyī,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.18.pli: “kathañhi nāma ayyo udāyī bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.18.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī get a nun to wash a used robe?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.19.pli: Atha kho tā bhikkhuniyo bhikkhūnaṃ etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.20.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.20.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.21.pli: “kathañhi nāma āyasmā udāyī bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpessatī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.21.eng: “How could Venerable Udāyī get a nun to wash a used robe?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.22.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ udāyiṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.22.eng: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.23.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, udāyi, bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpesī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.23.eng: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.27.pli: “Aññātako, moghapurisa, aññātikāya na jānāti patirūpaṃ vā appatirūpaṃ vā pāsādikaṃ vā apāsādikaṃ vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.27.eng: “Foolish man, a man and a woman who are unrelated don’t know what’s appropriate and inappropriate, what’s inspiring and uninspiring, in dealing with each other.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.28.pli: Tattha nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpessasi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.30.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.30.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.31.1.pli: “Yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:1.31.1.eng: ‘If a monk has an unrelated nun wash, dye, or beat a used robe, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.4.eng: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.6.pli: mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.6.eng: anyone who is not a descendant of one’s male ancestors going back eight generations, either on the mother’s side or on the father’s side.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.6.comm: Sp 1.505: Tattha yāva sattamā pitāmahayugāti pitupitā pitāmaho, pitāmahassa yugaṁ pitāmahayugaṁ, “In this yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means: the father of a father is a grandfather. The generation of a grandfather is called a pitāmahayuga.” So the PaIi phrase yāva sattamā pitāmahayuga means “as far as the seventh generation of grandfathers”, that is, eight generations back. This can be counted as follows: (1) one’s grandfather; (2) his father; (3) 2’s father; (4) 3’s father; (5) 4’s father; (6) 5’s father; and (7) 6’s father. This applies to both one’s paternal and maternal grandfathers. This gives a total of 14 ancestors. Anyone who is a descendent of these fourteen is considered a relative. Anyone who is not such a descendent is not regarded as a relative.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.8.eng: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.10.eng: a sarong or an upper robe, even worn once.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.11.eng: If he tells her to wash it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.12.eng: When it has been washed, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.13.eng: If he tells her to dye it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.14.eng: When it has been dyed, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.15.eng: If he tells her to beat it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.16.pli: Sakiṃ pāṇippahāraṃ vā muggarappahāraṃ vā dinne nissaggiyaṃ hoti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.16.eng: When she has struck it once with her hand or with an implement, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.17.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.17.eng: The robe should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.18.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.19.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.20.pli: idaṃ me, bhante, purāṇacīvaraṃ aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā dhovāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.20.eng: ‘Venerables, this used robe, which I got an unrelated nun to wash, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.21.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.1.24.eng: ‘I give this robe back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.1.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.1.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.2.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.2.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash and dye a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.3.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeti ākoṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.3.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash and beat a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.4.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeti rajāpeti ākoṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.4.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her wash, dye, and beat a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.5.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ rajāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.5.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.6.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ rajāpeti ākoṭāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.6.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye and beat a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.7.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ rajāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.7.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye and wash a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.8.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ rajāpeti ākoṭāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.8.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her dye, beat, and wash a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.9.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ ākoṭāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.9.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her beat a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.10.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ ākoṭāpeti dhovāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.10.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her beat and wash a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.11.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ ākoṭāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.11.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her beat and dye a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and one offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.12.pli: Aññātikāya aññātikasaññī purāṇacīvaraṃ ākoṭāpeti dhovāpeti rajāpeti, nissaggiyena āpatti dvinnaṃ dukkaṭānaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.12.eng: If she is unrelated and he perceives her as such, and he has her beat, wash, and dye a used robe, he commits one offense entailing relinquishment and two offenses of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.13.eng: If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.13.comm: Sp 1.506: Aññātikāya vematiko aññātikāya ñātikasaññīti imānipi padāni vuttānaṁyeva tiṇṇaṁ catukkānaṁ vasena vitthārato veditabbāni, “‘If she is unrelated, but he is unsure of it; if she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related’: these sentences should be understood in detail just as the stated three tetrads (above).”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.14.eng: If she is unrelated, but he perceives her as related …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.15.eng: If he has her wash a used robe belonging to someone else, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.16.eng: If he has her wash a sitting mat or a sheet, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.17.eng: If he has a nun who is fully ordained only on one side do the washing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.18.eng: If she is related, but he perceives her as unrelated, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.19.eng: If she is related, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.20.eng: If she is related and he perceives her as such, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.22.eng: if a related nun does the washing and an unrelated nun helps her;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.23.eng: if a nun does the washing without being asked;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.24.eng: if he has a nun wash an unused robe;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.25.eng: if he has a nun wash any requisite apart from a robe;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.26.eng: if it is a trainee nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.27.eng: if it is a novice nun;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.29.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np4:2.2.30.eng: The training rule on used robes, the fourth, is finished.
